intro: Henriettea brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian henriettea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Henriettea brasiliensis typically grows as an upright shrub with palmate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
